snippet: Gen. John W. Nicholson Jr. will lead a combined United States and NATO force of 13,000 troops, replacing Gen. John F. Campbell, who is retiring after a 37-year military career.
abstract: Army Gen John W Nicholson Jr takes command of American and NATO forces in Afghanistan from departing commander Gen John F Campbell.

byline.contributor: Khalid Alokozai contributed reporting from Jalalabad.

lead_paragraph: Gen. John W. Nicholson Jr. will lead a combined United States and NATO force of 13,000 troops, replacing Gen. John F. Campbell, who is retiring after a 37-year military career.

headline.main: New U.S. General Takes Command of Coalition Forces in Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Asia; Afghanistan: A New U.S. Commander

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
